intro: Galium triandrum, commonly known as sticky willow or wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in early spring. Galium triandrum is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
